name: 2._Read_Claude_Documentation_in_Vibeboard
keyDecisions:
The issue is that the code I added at line 300 and 341 is correctly checking for
sourceImages
.
The fix is working.
The issue is that the "pro" version may not be available on Fal.
The issue is the test that ran earlier was against the worktree server which didn't have the handler.

The issue is
image_urls
 (array) not
image_url
 (singular).
The issue is that when using AI Studio (non-Vertex), the API expects a different structure.
The issue is that my edits haven't been picked up because the server needs to restart.
The issue is the server needs to be restarted to pick up the changes.

The issue is that when the OpenAI SDK has an error,
error.

The issue is that the OpenAI SDK's
videos
 API might not exist or returns something unexpected.
The issue was the PROJECT_ID wasn't being expanded.

The issue is that
error.

the issue is:\

OpenAIAdapter.
The issue is that OpenAI Sora is an async job - it returns 'queued' and then needs to be polled for completion.
The issue is that Together and OpenAI adapters aren't using it to persist the images when they're generated.

The issue is that these models are returning
images instead of videos
.
the issue is about missing required inputs vs output parsing.

The issue is
missing required inputs
, not a code bug.
The issue is when users explicitly select these models without providing the inputs.

The issue is that
Character & Avatar
 is shown in the sidebar (line 91 includes 'avatar'), but when you click it, the filter at line 79 only checks
model.

keyDecisions:
The issue is that Claude Code needs to be
completely restarted
 to load new MCP servers.

The issue is that
Claude Code uses a different method to register MCP servers
.
The issue is with the MCP server package itself.
The issue is clear.

The fix is simple - just add
mode === 'video'
 to the condition so duration shows whenever video mode is selected:\

The issue is that Grok is seeing the tattoo on the thigh and thinking that's what you want to remove, when actually you're trying to remove the bikini string on the side of the torso.
the issue was intermittent or the user's previous experience was before fixes.

The issue is likely:\

d
deftab720
tightenfactor0

	1
Mask too narrow
 - The string is very thin, and the mask needs to fully cover it with some margin\

	2
Mask expansion too low
 - 10px may not be enough for thin objects that can cause edge ghosting\

the issue was mask coverage.
The issue is that when the AI looks at the full image, it's focusing on the most prominent removable element (the tattoo) rather than where your mask actually is.
